news.title: Godrej Interio to invest ₹300 crore; aims to double revenues to ₹10,000 crore by FY29
news.para: Godrej Interio plans a Rs 300 crore investment in business expansion and technology to double its revenue to Rs 10,000 crore by FY29. The company aims to increase its market share in the organized furniture sector to over 20%. This investment includes digital technologies, store expansion to 1,500 outlets, and design enhancements, shifting the revenue focus towards B2C growth.

news.title: Godrej preparing masterplan to develop 1,000 acres of Vikhroli land
news.para: The Godrej Enterprise Group is developing a masterplan for its expansive 1,000-acre Vikhroli property in Mumbai. Executive Director Nyrika Holkar confirmed ongoing manufacturing activities alongside future systematic development. While some land is leased to IT firms, Godrej & Boyce businesses remain.

news.title: ED attaches fresh ₹186 crore assets in bank fraud case against DHFL
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth approximately Rs 186 crore in the Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Limited (DHFL) loan fraud case. The attached assets include flats and receivables in Mumbai. The ED's action follows a CBI FIR against DHFL, Kapil Wadhawan, and Dheeraj Wadhawan. They are accused of siphoning off bank loan funds.

news.title: USA: Shortage of homebuyers forces many sellers to lower prices or walk away as sales slump drags on
news.para: Across the U.S., sellers are finding it harder to command top dollar as affordability challenges and new construction give buyers more leverage. Increased inventory, particularly in the South and West, is prompting price reductions and concessions. While national listing prices saw a slight rise in July, several metro areas experienced declines, signaling a shift in the housing market dynamic.

news.title: Sebi amends InvITs rules; cuts min investment threshold
news.para: SEBI has eased norms for InvITs and REITs, reducing the minimum allotment lot size for privately placed InvITs to ₹25 lakh, aligning it with secondary market norms. The regulator has also relaxed rules regarding related parties and cash flow distribution for holding companies.

news.title: Glass Wall Systems files draft papers with Sebi to raise funds via IPO
news.para: Glass Wall Systems (India) Ltd has filed papers with Sebi for an IPO, planning to raise funds through a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 60 crore and an OFS of 4.02 crore shares. The proceeds will be used for a GPU project and general corporate purposes.

news.title: NBCC inks pact with NMRDA to build Naveen Nagpur
news.para: NBCC (India) and NMRDA have partnered to develop Naveen Nagpur, an International Business & Finance Center (IBFC) spanning 1,710 acres. NBCC will act as the project management consultant for the 1,000-acre business district, focusing on commercial establishments, residential areas, and mixed-use developments. The project will be executed in three phases over 15 years.

news.title: Sundaram Home enters Karnataka; eyes ₹60 crore disbursements under EB segment
news.para: Sundaram Home Finance is expanding into Karnataka, targeting Tier II and III towns with 8-10 new branches. The company aims to disburse Rs 60 crore in the first year, focusing on small business loans and affordable housing finance. This move is driven by the potential in Karnataka's affordable housing segment, supported by government initiatives.

news.title: Flipspaces secures $50 million in series C round
news.para: Flipspaces secured USD 50 million in its expanded Series C funding, drawing investments from CE-Invests, Panthera Growth Partners, and SMBC Asia Rising Fund. This funding will fuel expansion in India, the U.S., and the U.A.E., alongside supply chain improvements and AI-driven technology enhancements. The round also facilitated the exit of early investor Carpe Diem.

news.title: Prayagraj civic body set to act tough on property tax defaulters
news.para: The Prayagraj Municipal Corporation is set to crack down on property owners, including over 200 commercial establishments, who owe nearly Rs 40-50 crore in unpaid property taxes. Despite repeated notices, these defaulters have ignored their dues, prompting the PMC to initiate strict recovery measures like property attachment.

news.title: RLDA invites bids for railway land parcels across Mumbai
news.para: Rail Land Development Authority plans to lease prime railway land in Mumbai. E-bids are invited for plots in Mahalaxmi, Parel, and Bandra East. The lease is for 99 years. These sites are near business hubs and transport networks. The project aims to develop residential and commercial spaces. This initiative will ensure optimal use of valuable property.

news.title: Uttarakhand to limit homestay scheme to permanent residents
news.para: Uttarakhand's tourism department is planning to restrict its homestay scheme to permanent residents due to misuse by outsiders operating commercial properties. The proposed changes aim to support local families and preserve the state's culture, addressing concerns about unregistered homestays and exploitation of residential resources. Amendments to regulations will include tax exemptions, registration periods, and stricter oversight to ensure compliance.

news.title: Vacant properties to go under the hammer in Chandigarh every four months
news.para: Chandigarh's estate office, encouraged by the successful auction of residential properties, plans quarterly auctions to increase property availability. The latest auction saw a Sector 33 property sold for Rs 33.4 crore, significantly above its reserve price.

news.title: Over 50 plots allotted on first day of Anant Nagar lottery
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority commenced the lottery for the Anant Nagar Housing Scheme, allotting 56 plots on the first day. The draw included plots of varying sizes, with around 1,400 applicants participating. Over the next two days, more plots will be allotted, with the scheme aiming to house approximately 1.5 lakh people across residential and commercial spaces.

news.title: Telangana RERA orders The Building Co to refund buyer's money with interest
news.para: Telangana Real Estate Regulatory Authority directed The Building Co to refund thirty lakh rupees with eleven percent annual interest to a flat buyer in Hyderabad. The order was due to violations in the 'TBC Rasagna North' project. The developer collected funds without registration. TG RERA also imposed a five lakh rupees penalty on the promoter.

news.title: Telangana RERA fines housing society for project violations
news.para: Telangana RERA has penalized Jubilee Hills Co-operative House Building Society Ltd with ₹18.5 lakh for launching a real estate project without mandatory RERA registration. The society was found advertising and collecting money for 'Jubilee Hills Phase IV' without approval. RERA has restrained the society from further activities until registration and compliance.

news.title: MahaRERA clears 5,267 complaints in 10 months, promises timely hearings for homebuyers
news.para: MahaRERA significantly expedited complaint resolution, disposing of 5,267 cases between October 2024 and July 2025, with hearings scheduled within one to two months of registration. While homebuyers welcome the faster process, they emphasize the importance of enforcing orders and ensuring project viability through stringent pre-approval scrutiny to protect investments and minimize disputes.

news.title: ED attaches ₹100 crore assets of Unnati Fortune Holdings in cheating case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has attached over Rs 100 crore in assets belonging to Unnati Fortune Holdings Limited and its realtor, Anil Mithas, in connection with a money laundering case. Mithas is accused of diverting Rs 126.30 crore from homebuyers' funds, hindering project completion. He was arrested in April and remains in judicial custody.

news.title: British real estate investor PRS REIT says KKR joins sale process
news.para: PRS REIT, a British real estate investment trust, has attracted interest from U.S. private equity firm KKR, who joined its formal sale process alongside an existing £631.6 million offer from Long Harbour. KKR has not yet made a bid, but PRS REIT shares surged 8.8% following the news, driven by weaker UK valuations attracting U.S.

news.title: Arunachal Pradesh cabinet approves bill to streamline urban growth, clears key rules
news.para: The Arunachal Pradesh Cabinet approved key initiatives, including a Bill for structured urban planning to manage rapid urbanization and access significant capital incentives. Approvals were also granted for new fire stations, property tax rules to boost municipal autonomy, and land allotment amendments. The state's revenue has seen substantial growth, supported by digital reforms and efficient fund management.
